title: Frequently see 'Error connecting to mail server'
body:
# Problem

I often see 'Error connecting to mail server' when opening the app.

# Implementation

Not sure, but:

1) Fix underlying problem
2) Automatically pick new mailserver for me

# Acceptance Criteria

Less manual action when opening app.

# Notes

I searched for 'error connecting to mailserver' in issues and couldn't find any duplicate issues.

Using Status nightly, mail-0{1,3}.do-ams3.eth.beta, recent nightly. 4G, good connection.

# Future Steps

Data sync layer and incentivization work work should make this problem go away, as one connection dying shouldn't been disruptive.

the initial issue and investigation: https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/7376

long story short: peers (public keys) get stuck on our mailserver side. if that happens, this peer can never connect to the same mailserver again.

(1) we added a dialog on status-react side to try to choose another mailserver
(2) we added monitoring of stale peers on the server side
(3) [wip] adding more logs to mailserver figure out where exactly it fails, current devp2p logs are less than useful there
(4) [plan] find a workaround (idk, force-remove this peer, or something)
(5) [plan] figure out the real issue

Any update on this? Considering how disruptive this it seems like fairly high priority.

It also seems likely connected to number of connections, considering how it behaved around Ethdenver. Has this hypothesis been tested? Do we have graphs for how many peers are dropped etc? Would be great to see them pasted in this issue if so, or a link to other relevant issues. cc @adambabik @jakubgs

This issue persisted all weekend at ETHDenver with no real relief. This was between multiple WiFi connections, and seemed only a little better on cellular but not enough to have an meaningful conversations.

I got pinged by our own team on telegram Saturday because they didn’t get my status messages, wasn’t cool.

**---> WE ARE HERE <----**
(4.5) make sure that the workaround is working
(5) [wip] figure out the real issue

Some of my thoughts:
- it might be related to the load of the wifi on EthDenver, this "stale peers" issue seems to reproduce much more frequently when a connection is either slow or a bit flaky (also explains why 3G might made it better).
- the clean-up script runs 1 time per 1 minute (which looks like not enough), so if your peer got stuck on the mailserver it is around 1 min until you can reconnect again.
@adambabik had some ideas about the root cause too, he was investigating that.

also, pivotal story: https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/163752166
Mailservers don't remove disconnected peers sometimes making it impossible to connect again - Pivotal Tracker

I was chasing a case where the TCP conn is half-open and the mail server never tries to send anything through the wire which I guess would keep the conn help-open for unbounded periods of time. This is not a case because there is [this `pingLoop()`](https://github.com/status-im/go-ethereum/blob/master/p2p/peer.go#L206) which does send messages every few seconds.

I was also checking `MsgPipeRW` but it also looks fine.

So back to square one... We are trying to analyze logs one more time in order to confirm for 100% that the problem is in `p2p.Server.runPeer()` and `p2p.Peer.run()` methods.

A bit of history of this issue (if it helps someone)

so basicall, the story
(1) Anna had an Android device that wasn't able to connect to some mailservers (like never able to), Sergey had the same issue as well (with diferent mailserver)
(2) We thought that it is an issue on a mobile-app side, so I started debugging (turned out that one of the test accounts on my test Pixel also can't connect to one of the mailservers.
(3) I found that there is a log entry "error: already connected" in logcat, so I tried to take a look at that, grep-ed the code, found this string and changed it to already connected from local to make sure that that is the right place
(4) I updated status-go with the new string, but still got "error: already connected"(the old string) in the log
(5) So, I found the code that reads the error from the other peer and deserializes it. When it is converted to a string (reason) I added arbitrary suffix ++ there, to check if that is where this error comes from.
(6) yes, I got "error: already connected++"(the patched string) in the log, so the error came from the mailserver
(7) the only place where this error comes from is when you do a handshake with a peer that is already in server.peers in p2p module.
(8) I suggested to restart the mailserver that I couldn't connect to to validate. After restart it connected just fine.
(9) we restarted all the mailservers and Anna's and Sergey's issues were gone.

*I was a bit busy, so between (2) and (7) around 2 days passed

I just did a live debugging session with @pablanopete. It looks like we show this "error/retry" dialog erroneously if a server takes too long to connect or something. So, in his case. He starts the app, it connects to a mailserver (shows the gray "Connecting..." label). Then he gets "Error when connecting to the mailserver" dialog, but **behind** this dialog everything connects just fine. Logs in Kibana support that too: So maybe quite a bit of complains on ETHDenver (and @oskarth's subpar experience) were because of that. @annadanchenko can you make an issue for that, **showing this dialog in most case is a UI bug**. Here we can continue tracking stale peers down.

also, additional logs to figure out what exactly deadlocks
so, Whisper deadlocks causing devp2p to deadlock. solid.

(3) Not even attempting to connect is still TBD, but let's see how other fixes will affect it.
